Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치의 눈에 우리의 뇌를 넣은 건 정말 잘한 일이야.
English (United States)(en-US): We did a good job putting\nour brains in Dot’s eyeballs.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치가 기압차 때문에 터지지 않았다는 걸 알 수 있었다! 안심이 돼.
English (United States)(en-US): We could see Dot didn’t\nexplode from the change in\natmospheric pressure! Phew.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 동의함.
English (United States)(en-US): “Phew” indeed.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 게다가 인간!!을 다시금 바라볼 수 있었어! 우리의 아름답고 멋진 인간들을 말이야.
English (United States)(en-US): On top of that, we got\nto see our beautiful\nsplendid humans!! Again!!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 역시 동의한다.
English (United States)(en-US): Indeed.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러게. 뭉치가 한 명의 인간을 제외한 나머지 인간들에겐 보이지 않았어!
English (United States)(en-US): Huh. True. Only one human—\nand none of the rest—could see Dot!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 왜? 그러한 특성은 관찰되지 않았었는데?
English (United States)(en-US): But why? Such an attribute\nwas not previously observed.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간의 눈? 뭉치의 성분? 혹은 그저 작고 까맣기 때문?
English (United States)(en-US): Hm. The naked human eye?\nDot’s composition? Or simply because\nthey are small and black?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어! 그렇네! 드리미네슘 때문일 수도 있겠네!
English (United States)(en-US): Oh! Right! Maybe it’s\nbecause of Dreaminisium!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ...... 가장 유력한 가설인 듯. 폐기물의 구성 성분을 조사해 보겠음.
English (United States)(en-US): ...... Highly possible.\nWill analyze the\ncomponents of the Filth.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 반지 소년은 그 꿈을 꾸고 일어나... 최악의 슬픈 아침을 보냈겠지.
English (United States)(en-US): Ring Boy must have woken up\nfrom that dream... and faced\nthe worst morning of his life.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나를 잡아먹는 나의 공허. 그것을 견뎌야만 한다니.
English (United States)(en-US): A void that devours me,\none that’s mine. I can’t\nimagine having to live with it.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 잘못이 아님에도... 그 벌은 나의 것이어야만 한다니.
English (United States)(en-US): Having to take the blame...\nwhen none of it is my fault.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드.
English (United States)(en-US): Red.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그것은 해답 없는 인간 세상의 난제. 우리는 채 이해 못 하는 인간들의 이야기.
English (United States)(en-US): It is a problem with no answer\nthat stems from the human world.\nOne beyond our comprehension.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 자체로 아름다운 것이라 받아들이면 됨.
English (United States)(en-US): Accept that it is beautiful in itself.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 싫어. 나의 마지막 인간 아이가 떠오른단 말이야. 그건 아름답지 않아.
English (United States)(en-US): I won’t. That story reminds\nme of my last human kid.\nNothing beautiful there.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아름다운 인간이 왜 다른 아름다운 인간에게
English (United States)(en-US): Why would one beautiful\nhuman leave an ugly hole,

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 평생을 틀어 막고 살아도 메워지지 않는 추한 구멍을 남기는 거야?
English (United States)(en-US): one that won’t mend for\nthe rest of their life\non a fellow beautiful human?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아직도... 나의 인간을 괴롭히던 인간들의 표정이 생생하게 기억 나.
English (United States)(en-US): I... I still remember the looks\non the faces of the humans\nthat bullied my human kid.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 정말로 아름답지 않았어. 비겁하고 끔찍했어.
English (United States)(en-US): They didn’t look beautiful.\nThey looked cowardly and awful.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑하는 인간들에게 이런 마음을 가지는 것이 죄스럽지만... 난. 나는....
English (United States)(en-US): It kills me to feel this way\ntoward the humans I love...\nBut I. I....

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달리 어떻게 느껴야 할지 모르겠단 말이야....
English (United States)(en-US): I don't know how else to feel....

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 수많은 얼굴들을 빙그르르 돌리던 하얀 모자 인간! 정말 황홀하고 아름다웠어!
English (United States)(en-US): White Hat, spinning those\nendless faces! It was awesome!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리 안에도 하얀 모자 인간처럼 수많은 얼굴들이 살고 있을까?
English (United States)(en-US): I wonder if we have many\nfaces inside too like that guy?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 그저 오물을 치우는 달 청소부들.
English (United States)(en-US): We are filth cleaners on the Moon.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리에게 다면성은 비효율적이고 시끄럽고 피로할 뿐.
English (United States)(en-US): Multiple faces for us will be\ninefficient, rowdy and tiring.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘얼굴’은 하나면 충분함.
English (United States)(en-US): One ‘face’ is enough.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니! 나는 다섯 개 가지고 싶다!
English (United States)(en-US): Nope! I want five of ‘em!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 첼로 경은 일곱 개 가지고 싶다는데!
English (United States)(en-US): And Sir Cello here wants seven!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 근데 왜 일곱 개지?
English (United States)(en-US): Why seven though?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 도레미-파솔라시!
English (United States)(en-US): Oh, do-re-mi-fa-sol-la-ti!
... Fine.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 몇 개?
English (United States)(en-US): How about you?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘양면성’을 가진 기분은 궁금하나,\n효율성을 해치고 싶진 않다.\n그러니 두 개.
English (United States)(en-US): Three.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러게... 우리를 보고 싶어 했을 줄은 몰랐어. 짜식, 감동인걸!
English (United States)(en-US): I know... I didn’t think\nDot would miss us either.\nKid’s gonna make me cry!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아무리 고민해도 뭉치가 우리를 다시 볼 수 있는 방법은 없다.
English (United States)(en-US): Zero possible ways for\nDot to see us again.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 뭉치의 그리움은 길 없는 그리움.
English (United States)(en-US): Ergo, Dot will continue\nto long for us.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 그 무게를 잘 알지. 하지만, 그럼에도......
English (United States)(en-US): We know well how heavy\nit feels. But even so......

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고마운 것 같음.
English (United States)(en-US): I feel gratitude.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 맞아. 뭉치가 정말 이곳에서의 기억을 잊겠다고 선택했으면 마음이 찢어졌을 거야.......
English (United States)(en-US): Yeah. If Dot really chose\nto forget us, it would’ve\nbroken my heart.......

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 걱정 마라, 첼로. 뭉치에게 그런 능력이 있다는 건 관찰하지 못했다.
English (United States)(en-US): Not to worry, Cello.\nDot showed no signs of\npossessing such abilities.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치의 강렬한 소망이었을 뿐, 기억을 정말 지우지는 못했을 것임.
English (United States)(en-US): Merely a fervent desire.\nActual memory removal\nwould have been impossible.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치는 똑똑한 괴물 덩어리니까. 아마 그도 알고 있었을 테지.
English (United States)(en-US): Dot is a clever critter.\nThey must have known.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘 뭉치가 했던 말은...
English (United States)(en-US): What Dot said today...

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 울어?
English (United States)(en-US): Are you crying?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안 울어! 안 운다고!
English (United States)(en-US): Am not! Am not!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 놀리지 마라, 첼로 경!
English (United States)(en-US): Not you too, Sir Cello!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “나의 일부는 언제나 레드의 일부일 테야.”
English (United States)(en-US): “That part of Red will\nalways be a part of me.”

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이런, 진짜 울잖아.
English (United States)(en-US): Oh. You really are crying.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치는 찌질이 바보임.
English (United States)(en-US): Dot is dumb.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 똑똑한 괴물 덩어리일 줄 알았는데.
English (United States)(en-US): I thought they were\na clever blob of a monster.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말 떠날까 봐 어찌나 조마조마하던지.
English (United States)(en-US): I was so nervous thinking\nthey would actually leave.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이것 봐. 머리 쥐어뜯느라 손이 다 시커매졌다니까.
English (United States)(en-US): Look. My hands are\nall sooty from\npulling out my hair.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ......더 시커매질 게 남았었던가?
English (United States)(en-US): ...... Were they not sooty already?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이미 성냥개비라니! 아니거든, 아니라고!
English (United States)(en-US): Who are you calling\na burnt-out matchstick!\nAm not, am not!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘 뭉치가 보고 온 인간 말이야.......
English (United States)(en-US): The human Dot observed today......

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 웃을 때 참 아름다웠어. 주변이 환해지는 것 같았다고.
English (United States)(en-US): His smile was so beautiful.\nLike, the world around him lit up.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 얼굴이 빨갛다, 레드.
English (United States)(en-US): You’re blushing, Red.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니! 아니! 왜 나에게 물을 붓지?
English (United States)(en-US): What? No! Why would\nyou throw water at me?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 싫어! 다시 타오르려면 한참을 말려야 한다고!
English (United States)(en-US): Come on! It takes me forever\nto dry myself and burn up again!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아-아무튼.
English (United States)(en-US): A-Anyway.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 인간이 자신의 웃음을 지켜 냈으면 좋겠어.
English (United States)(en-US): I hope that human can\npreserve his smile.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 온전히 슬퍼하다 보면, 온전히 웃을 수도 있을 거라고?
English (United States)(en-US): “Once you’re entirely sad,\nyou’ll be able to\nsmile entirely as well?”

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치가 비슷한 말을 했던 것 같은데.......
English (United States)(en-US): Dot said something similar earlier......

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잘 이해되지는 않지만, 멋있는 철학이 담겨 있을 것만 같은 말이다! 좋아!
English (United States)(en-US): I don’t completely understand it,\nbut there seems to be a splendid\nphilosophy behind it! I like it!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭐? 정말? 치커리 영감이랑 오물 치우느라 못 봤어!
English (United States)(en-US): What? Really? I didn’t catch it.\nI was out cleaning filth\nwith Old Man Chicory!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치 이 자식, 결국 편지를 주러 다녀왔구나! 장하다!
English (United States)(en-US): I knew Dot could do it!\nThey finally delivered the\nletter! I’m so proud!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ...! 가방에 넣으려다 몸이 지퍼에 뜯겼다고?
English (United States)(en-US): ...! Part of Dot’s body was ripped out\nwhen they tried to put\nthe letter in the bag?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 근데 또 다시 자라났어?!
English (United States)(en-US): But then the ripped-out part\ngrew back?!
What a relief......

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그나저나 아이가 편지를 읽었을까? 읽었으면 좋겠다!
English (United States)(en-US): Anyway, do you think the child\nread the letter? I hope he did!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치 글씨체, 하도 찌글거려서 해독할 수는 있을까 걱정이군.
English (United States)(en-US): Dot’s handwriting is so wriggly\nthat I worry he won’t be able\nto decode it.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치가 꿈이 되면 죽는다니... 한 번도 그렇게 생각해 본 적이 없어.
English (United States)(en-US): Dot dying once they become\na dream... I never thought\nof it that way.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ....... 난 뭉치에게 사실상 죽으라고 권유한 셈인 거야.
English (United States)(en-US): ...... I basically egged Dot on\nto go and kick the bucket.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이거야말로 정말 나쁘고 멍청한 놈이나 할 법한 짓이잖아!
English (United States)(en-US): What a suck-y stupid thing to say!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 게다가 꿈이 인간의 머릿속에서 영원히 살아가는 존재라고 믿고 있었을 줄은....
English (United States)(en-US): And to think Dot thought dreams\nlive on forever in a human’s mind...

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘꿈은 인간의 영원한 친구’란 표어를 어떻게 그렇게 해석할 수 있냐는 말이야!!
English (United States)(en-US): Who understands ‘dreams are forever\nfriends’ like that!?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드, 진정. 나 역시 미처 고려하지 못했음.
English (United States)(en-US): Calm down, Red. I too did not\nforesee this.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달에서 들었던 말들과, 인간들이 알고 있는 꿈에 대한 정보가 서로 부합하지 않을 때에는
English (United States)(en-US): When what Dot heard on the Moon\nand what humans know of\ndreams did not click,

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 균열을 본인의 상상으로 채워 나갔던 것 같음.
English (United States)(en-US): Dot seems to have filled that chasm\nwith their own imagination.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러게. 저 괴물 덩어리, 생각보다 바보였음.
English (United States)(en-US): Indeed. Even more foolish than\nwe thought.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그나저나 정말... 이제 어쩌지.
English (United States)(en-US): So now... what to do.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그냥... 우리 걱정 같은 건 하지 말고.
English (United States)(en-US): How about we just...\ndon’t worry.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈이 되지 않고 오래 오래 살아 주면 좋겠어. 새까만 몸뚱이도 나름 귀엽단 말이야!
English (United States)(en-US): I’d rather they don’t end up a dream\nand live long. Dot’s kinda cute,\nin a muddy way!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이걸 뭉치에게 전할 길이 있다면.......
English (United States)(en-US): If only there was a way\nto tell them......

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치의 인간이 우리의 따스함을 알아주어 다행이었어.
English (United States)(en-US): I’m glad Dot’s human recognized\nus and our warmth.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘따스하게 겹쳐 쌓인 선율 같은 이들’이라 해 줬다고.
English (United States)(en-US): They called us ‘warmly layered melodies.’

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 따스하게 겹쳐 쌓인 선율... 훌쩍.
English (United States)(en-US): Warmly layered melodies... sniff

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말 감동적이야.......
English (United States)(en-US): It’s just too much......

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데... 오늘 뭉치가 보고 온 인간을 떠올리면 마음이 다시 아파져.
English (United States)(en-US): But... thinking about the human\nDot saw today makes me sad.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 맞아, 간절히 응원하기. 우리가 할 수 있는 유일한 일이지.
English (United States)(en-US): You’re right, wishing them the best.\nIt’s all we can do.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지구에선 보이지도 않는 달의 뒤편에서 보내는 응원이지만.
English (United States)(en-US): Best wishes from the dark side of\nthe Moon, impossible to see\nfrom Earth.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무력해. 고통에 찬 인간에게 해 줄 수 있는 게, 그를 사랑하는 것밖에 없어....
English (United States)(en-US): I feel useless. All we can do\nfor a human in pain is\nto love them...

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말? 우리의 존재를 몰라도, 보거나 느낄 수조차 없어도 힘이 될 수 있다니?
English (United States)(en-US): Really? Even if they can’t see or feel\nus, and don’t even know we\nexist, we can still help them?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마음은 켜켜이 쌓인다...? 그게 무슨 뜻이지?
English (United States)(en-US): It collects like snowflakes...?\nWhat does that mean?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음... 음... 으음... 여전히 모르겠어.
English (United States)(en-US): Hmm... mm... mmm...\nI’ve got nothing.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만... 멋진 말이다!
English (United States)(en-US): But... it has a nice ring to it!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 에디슨, 첼로 경! ‘루시드 드림’에 대해 알고 있었어?
English (United States)(en-US): Edison, Sir Cello! You ever\nheard of ‘lucid dreams?’

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 처음 들음. 치커리 영감은 얼핏 알고 있는 듯했지만,
English (United States)(en-US): Negative. Old Man Chicory\nused to know about it,

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나이가 하도 먹어서인지 기억이 가물가물한 것 같음.
English (United States)(en-US): but old age must have blurred\nhis memory.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭐어? 두 번째로 맡았던 인간이 루시드 드리머였다고?
English (United States)(en-US): Whaaat? Your second human\nwas a lucid dreamer?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어땠어? 어땠어? 세상에나 이런 일이! 루시드 드림은 어떻게 만들어지는 거야?
English (United States)(en-US): What was it like? That’s crazy!\nHow are lucid dreams created?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우와! 신기해! 에디슨, 이게 말이 돼?
English (United States)(en-US): Wow! Cool! Edison, get this!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 루시드 드림을 터득한 인간들의 꿈 구슬에는 작고 특별한 문이 달려 있대!
English (United States)(en-US): Apparently lucid dreamers have a tiny,\nspecial door attached to their\nDream Marbles!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 문을 통해 꿈속으로 들어가는 거야? 너무! 너무! 신비롭고 희귀한 일이다!
English (United States)(en-US): So they walk inside their dreams through\nthat door? This is so! so!\nmagical and rare!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 연구. 연구.
English (United States)(en-US): Research. Research.
...... E-Edison?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 연구 필요함. 연구 필요함.
English (United States)(en-US): Research needed. Research needed.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 전구 머리가... 엄청나게 빛나고 있어?
English (United States)(en-US): Her lightbulb head is...\nshining so bright!

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리에게도 암흑이 있을까?
English (United States)(en-US): Do you think there is darkness\nwithin us as well?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 암흑이라....
English (United States)(en-US): Darkness....

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음. 어젯밤 문득 이런 생각이 들었음.
English (United States)(en-US): Hmm. It occurred to me last night.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 인간을 사랑하며 그 주위를 공전하도록 설계되었지만,
English (United States)(en-US): We were designed to love humans\nand revolve around them,

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 결코 그들의 고마움도, 애정도, 인정도 받을 수 없지.\n그들은 꿈마저도 중요히 여기지 않는다고 하니....
English (United States)(en-US): but cannot receive their gratitude, affection, or\nacknowledgement. Especially since dreams are\napparently unimportant to them...

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 부조리하다고 생각하며 세 시간 동안 우주 너머를 바라보았음.
English (United States)(en-US): I stared into space for three hours and\ncontemplated on the unfairness\nof the matter.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 막막하고 답답했다. 아마 나는 그때 내 암흑 속을 헤엄치는 중이었겠지.
English (United States)(en-US): Lonely and stifling. I suspect I had been\nworking through my own darkness\nat the time.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭐? 첼로 경! 첼로 경은 밤마다 악몽을 꾼다고? 저런.......
English (United States)(en-US): What? Sir Cello! You have\nnightmares every night?\nGeez......

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들은 수면 안대라는 것을 사용한다고 함.
English (United States)(en-US): Humans are reported to utilize\nsomething called a sleep mask.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 첼로 경을 위한 수면 안대 프로토타입을 한번 만들어 보겠음.
English (United States)(en-US): I will attempt to construct a sleep mask\nprototype for you, Sir Cello.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도... 차디찬 물로 걸어들어가던 그 인간 아이의 마지막 날을 떠올릴 때면
English (United States)(en-US): Me too... Whenever I think about my\nhuman kid and how he walked into\nthe cold cold water...

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 엄청난 슬픔에 잠기게 돼......
English (United States)(en-US): It makes me sadder than anything......
Oooh......

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리의 암흑이 아무리 우리를 어렵고 힘들게 한다지만.
English (United States)(en-US): Even if the darkness inside makes\nus struggle and hurt.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 미워하고 싶지 않아.
English (United States)(en-US): I don’t wanna hate it.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 머릿속에서 암흑을 떼어 내면 그 아이도 함께 사라질 것만 같거든.
English (United States)(en-US): I feel like if the darkness goes away,\nso will the kid.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치와의 작별이 얼마 남지 않았을 것만 같은 슬픈 예감이 들어.
English (United States)(en-US): I have a sad feeling that we have very\nlittle time until Dot leaves us.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (슬픈 선율이 연주된다)
English (United States)(en-US): (Sad music plays.)

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제 뭉치의 눈을 통해 인간들을 바라보는 것도, 뭉치의 여정을 응원하는 것도 할 수 없어.
English (United States)(en-US): No more observing humans through\nDot’s eyes, or cheering Dot on.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다시 청소, 청소, 또 청소일 뿐인 일상으로 돌아가는 거야....
English (United States)(en-US): We’ll have to go back to our monotonous days\nof cleaning, cleaning, and more cleaning.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치와 함께한 시간이 우리에게도 커다란 변화를 만들어 냈을 거라고?
English (United States)(en-US): You think our time with Dot will have\ntransformed us hugely?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 맞아. 다시 돌아가도 예전 같지는 않을 것임. 분명히 알 수 있다.
English (United States)(en-US): You are correct. Even when we go\nback, things will not be the same.\nI am sure of that.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 문득 궁금한 게 생겼어.
English (United States)(en-US): Wait, I have a question.

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 우리는 뭉치의 인간에게 어떤 모양으로 각인될까?
English (United States)(en-US): ... In what shapes will we be imprinted\non Dot’s human?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 세 명이니 세모난 모양?
English (United States)(en-US): A triangle, since there’s three of us?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 웃어야 하는 거지?
English (United States)(en-US): I’m supposed to laugh, right?

Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 웃어라.
English (United States)(en-US): Laugh.
